name: .SCPRESETS File Extension
summary: Learn about .SCPRESETS files and view a list of programs that open them.

description: An SCPRESETS file is a settings file created by Snap Converter, an image conversion utility for macOS. It contains saved settings used for converting single images or images in batch mode. Example settings include the target file type (e.g., JPEG, PNG, etc.), resize options, watermark settings, and file renaming options.

content: SCPRESETS files allow you to switch between different option sets depending on your conversion job. For example, one presets file may be used for batch converting thumbnails for your website, while another might be used for watermarking photos before sending them to a prospective client.

Snap Converter presets files are saved using Apple's .PLIST file format, and they contain plain text properties for settings on the user interface. You can modify an SCPRESETS file manually, but be careful because changes in the embedded properties could cause unintended consequences.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
